title: "expected specialization failed to hold" ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
Trying to build the cargo project in https://github.com/citybound/citybound.git at commit `6df7126ee94209d98d71e713872116e3fdfb49dc` and ran directly into a compiler bug

I tried this code:
```
RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo run
```

I expected to see this happen: some sort of running application
Instead, this happened: something exploded and resulted in a red `error: internal compiler error` message

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.32.0-nightly (b68fc18c4 2018-11-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: b68fc18c45350e1cdcd83cecf0f12e294e55af56
commit-date: 2018-11-27
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.32.0-nightly
LLVM version: 8.0
```
Backtrace:

```
➜  citybound git:(master) RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo run
   Compiling uuid v0.7.1
   Compiling cb_simulation v0.3.0 (/Users/ben/work/games/rust-caper/citybound/cb_simulation)
   Compiling compact v0.2.13
   Compiling lyon_geom v0.9.0
   Compiling alga v0.7.1
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc/traits/specialize/mod.rs:104: When translating substitutions for specialization, the expected specialization failed to hold

thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:600:9
   Compiling lyon_path v0.9.0
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace

query stack during panic:
#0 [mir_built] processing `<compact_dict::CompactDict<K, V, A> as compact::Compact>::decompact`
#1 [unsafety_check_result] processing `<compact_dict::CompactDict<K, V, A> as compact::Compact>::decompact`
#2 [mir_const] processing `<compact_dict::CompactDict<K, V, A> as compact::Compact>::decompact`
#3 [mir_validated] processing `<compact_dict::CompactDict<K, V, A> as compact::Compact>::decompact`
#4 [borrowck] processing `<compact_dict::CompactDict<K, V, A> as compact::Compact>::decompact`
end of query stack
error: aborting due to previous error


note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.32.0-nightly (b68fc18c4 2018-11-27) running on x86_64-apple-darwin

note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=1 -C codegen-units=4 -C debuginfo=2 -C debug-assertions=on --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `compact`.
```

`uname -a`:
```
Darwin Bens-MacBook.local 17.7.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.7.0: Thu Jun 21 22:53:14 PDT 2018; root:xnu-4570.71.2~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64 i386 MacBook9,1 Darwin
```

```
ProductName:    Mac OS X
ProductVersion: 10.13.6
BuildVersion:   17G65
```
